intro: Nerium divaricatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it has a milky sap that is toxic, giving it its common name. Nerium divaricatum is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
